transcript.title: $1 MILLION FOR MANUKA OVAL UPGRADE
transcript.content:
I am delighted to announce today the provision of $1 million towards

the re-development of Manuka Oval.

While Manuka Oval is undoubtedly one of the most picturesque grounds

in Australia, the ACT Government and ACT Cricket Association have

been concerned for some time at the standard of facilities at the

Oval.

The Commonwealth's funding of developments from the Federation

Fund will complement the $1 million grant which has been committed

by the ACT Government.

In addition to the work underway to refurbish the Bradman Pavilion

and provide improved public and corporate seating, the Commonwealth's

funding will allow public, press, sponsor and player facilities to

be brought up to the standard required by the Australian Cricket Board.

As well as hosting the annual Prime Minister's XI match and the

Canberra Comets in the Mercantile Mutual Cup, the improved facilities

will assist the Association to attract other national and international

sporting fixtures to the Oval, to the benefit of Canberra's economy

and recreational sector.

The upgrade will increase the Oval's chances of hosting Australian

Football League matches in future.

The federal Government's grant of $1 million, in partnership

with the ACT Government's work, will provide significant support

to the Canberra community, and in particular strengthen Canberra's

sporting infrastructure for first class cricket and high standard

Australian Football League games.

17 December 1998
